page.title: 08Lislecombe
page.content: Great changes were effected in the area when Steephill Castle and the Royal National Hospital for Diseases of the Chest, were demolished and St.Lawrence Hall the home of Earl Jellicoe was destroyed by fire. However, one building of outstanding character still remains; the house at {Lislecombe} where{Alfred Noyes,}the poet, lived. Today his son Hugh and his family live here and devote their time to running a dairy farm. The farm has 160 acres of land on which Mr.Noyes keeps 170 Friesian cows. The beautiful garden overlooking Orchard Bay has many tall graceful trees and unusual shrubs. The grounds are used for the breeding of{rare {duck}and other birds. There are also many different varieties of flowers and 7 different kinds of fruit trees in the garden.
